topic_descriptions.13: loop, statements, forward looking, forward, looking statements

sample_docs: Illinois Biometric Information Notice Last Updated: November 12, 2020 This Illinois Biometric Information Notice ("Notice") applies to Illinois residents and provides information about the Biometric Information that we collect from such residents, our use of such information, and length of time we can keep such information, as required by the Illinois Biometric Information Privacy Act ("IBIPA"). This Notice of does not apply to any other types of Personally Identifiable Information collected from Illinois residents. This Notice is incorporated by reference into our , and the capitalized that appear in this Notice have the same meanings as in CERTIFY's , unless they are defined in this Notice. TYPES OF BIOMETRIC INFORMATION Biometric Information may include any type of information sufficient to identify you by your physical characteristics, such as fingerprint, voiceprint, retina, iris, face, and temperature scans. Biometric Information does not include photographs or information collected in a healthcare setting. USE OF BIOMETRIC INFORMATION We may collect and store your Biometric Information when you use the Services. The purpose of collecting, storing, and using your Biometric Information is to enable us to provide the Services. When you use the Services, you will be asked to indicate that you consent to our collection, storage, and use of your Biometric Information in accordance with the of this Notice by clicking on a checkbox, by entering you name, or by similar means. You agree that such indication of consent is your written release regarding our collection, storage, and use of your Biometric Information under the IBIPA. We will not sell, license, share, or disclose your Biometric Information, except as set forth in this Notice, or with your consent, or to complete a financial transaction requested or authorized by you, and we will use such information only as set forth this Notice. RETENTION OF BIOMETRIC INFORMATION We may retain your Biometric Information for a period three (3) years from your last use of the Services, unless you request the deletion of your Biometric Information prior to that time pursuant to our . DISCLOSURE OF BIOMETRIC INFORMATION We may disclose certain Biometric Information to product and/or service providers who assist us in providing the Services. The Biometric Information disclosed to such companies will be limited to information sufficient to provide the Services, to support the Services, to enhance the Services, or to verify or supplement the information in your account. We may disclose Biometric Information to third parties: (a) to comply with a valid legal demands for such information; (b) to protect our company or any of its owners, directors, officers, employees, agents, customers, or anyone else; (c) to enable us to investigate actual, attempted, threatened, or suspected violations of our of Use or other agreements, or to enforce our of Use or other agreements; or (d) pursuant to any acquisition, merger, or sale of all or substantially all of our business. The disclosure of Biometric Information to third parties to comply with valid legal demands for such information is governed by our Compelled Disclosures Policy . of Use California Collection Notice Illinois Biometric Information Notice Compelled Disclosures Policy Cookies Policy Developer of Use E-Business policy GDPR Policy Government Disclosures Policy Hardware Policy Business Associate Agreement Non-Disclosure Agreement Service Level Agreement Illinois Biometric Information Notice Last Updated: November 12, 2020 This Illinois Biometric Information Notice ("Notice") applies to Illinois residents and provides information about the Biometric Information that we collect from such residents, our use of such information, and length of time we can keep such information, as required by the Illinois Biometric Information Privacy Act ("IBIPA"). Healthcare We provide verification services for both patients and physicians to ensure increased proficiency in your business. Fever Detection & Thermal Scanning Solution CERTIFY is the #1 Fever Detection & Thermal Scanning Solution in the marketplace. With thousands of devices sold, our patented combination of thermal scanning technology, The most advanced authentication platform in the world Try Auth for 30 days and sample every feature with unlimited users .You can easily convert when ready. CERTIFY saves you time and money while providing multiple products and solutions for your business needs. The amount of frustration that has been removed from our day is insurmountable. We have over 6 million patient visits per year and have never implemented a service that improves the patient experience, streamlines workflow, saves us time, saves us money, and eliminates fraud as much as the CERTIFY platform. CALIFORNIA COLLECTION NOTICE Last Updated: August 26, 2020 This California Collection Notice ("Notice") applies to California residents and provides information about the categories of Personally Identifiable Information that we collect from such residents, the purposes for which we use the information, the sources of the information, and the categories of third parties to whom we disclose the information for business purposes, as required by the California Consumer Privacy Act ("CCPA"). This Notice is incorporated by reference into our , and the capitalized that appear in this Notice have the same meanings as in CERTIFY's , unless they are defined in this Notice. Types Of Personal Information Personally Identifiable Information may include names, addresses, telephone numbers, email addresses, birth dates, and similar types of information. Personally Identifiable Information may also include demographic information, employment information, financial information, and similar types of information. Personally Identifiable Information may also include Biometric Information, such as fingerprint, voiceprint, retina, iris, face, and temperature scans. Use Of Personal Information We may use your Personally Identifiable Information to provide the Services and for related purposes, including to communicate with you about the Services and to facilitate the operation of our business. We will not sell, license, share, or disclose your Personally Identifiable Information, except as set forth in this Notice and our , or with your consent, and we will use such information only as set forth this Notice or our . Do Not Sell My Personal Information Under the CCPA, a business does not "sell" Personally Identifiable Information when a consumer uses or directs the business to intentionally disclose the information. Thus, when you use the Service for the purpose of intentionally disclosing your Personally Identifiable Information to the entity on whose behalf the Services are provided, we are not selling your Personally Identifiable Information for purposes of the CCPA. If you believe that disclosing your Personally Identifiable Information to such entity constitutes selling the Services, you may request that we not sell your information by contacting us at info@certifyglobal.com . However, using your Personally Identifiable Information is necessary to provide the Services, and if you indicate that you do not want us to use your Personally Identifiable Information to provide such Services, you will not be able to use the Services. Sources Of Personal Information The sources of the Personally Identifiable Information we collect are you and/or the entity on whose behalf the Services are provided. Disclosure Of Personal Information We may disclose certain Personally Identifiable Information to product and/or service providers who assist us in providing the Services. The Personally Identifiable Information disclosed to such companies will be limited to information sufficient to provide the Services, to support the Services, to enhance the Services, or to verify or supplement the information in your account. We may disclose Personally Identifiable Information to third parties: (a) to comply with a valid legal demands for such information; (b) to protect our company or any of its owners, directors, officers, employees, agents, customers, or anyone else; (c) to enable us to investigate actual, attempted, threatened, or suspected violations of our of Use or other agreements, or to enforce our of Use or other agreements; or (d) pursuant to any acquisition, merger, or sale of all or substantially all of our business. The disclosure of Personally Identifiable Information to third parties to comply with valid legal demands for such information is governed by our Government Disclosures Policy . of Use California Collection Notice Illinois Biometric Information Notice Compelled Disclosures Policy Cookies Policy Developer of Use E-Business policy GDPR Policy Government Disclosures Policy Hardware Policy Business Associate Agreement Non-Disclosure Agreement Service Level Agreement CALIFORNIA COLLECTION NOTICE Last Updated: August 26, 2020 This California Collection Notice ("Notice") applies to California residents and provides information about the categories of Personally Identifiable Information that we collect from such residents, the purposes for which we use the information, the sources of the information, and the categories of third parties to whom we disclose the information for business purposes, as required by the California Consumer Privacy Act ("CCPA"). HARDWARE POLICY Last Updated: April 16, 2019 This Hardware Policy applies to all products purchased through CERTIFY ("Products"), including through our Website or sales representatives, and is incorporated by reference into CERTIFY's of Use . Such Products may include such as biometric readers, hardware tokens, and other hardware used in connection with the Services. The capitalized that appear in this policy have the same meanings as in CERTIFY's of Use , unless they are defined in this policy. By purchasing the Products, you agree to this Hardware Policy. IF YOU DO NOT AGREE TO THE THIS HARDWARE POLICY, YOU MAY NOT USE THE SERVICES. USE OF PRODUCTS Your use of the Products is governed by CERTIFY's of Use . RETURN OF PRODUCTS CANCELLATION You may return and receive a full refund for Products purchased through CERTIFY if you purchase the Products within thirty (30) days of opening an Account and cancel your Account at any time during the same period, so long as the Products are in their original condition and packaging and you enclose the original packaging slip. You may not return and receive a full refund for Products purchased through CERTIFY if you purchase the products more than thirty (30) days after opening an Account, except pursuant to the following Limited Warranty. Refunds will be applied to the original purchase method. Only Products purchased directly from CERTIFY can be returned to CERTIFY. Any products you purchase from a third party must be returned in accordance with the third party's policies. DEFECTIVE PRODUCTS You may return defective Products purchased through CERTIFY and receive replacement Products pursuant to the following Limited Warranty. LIMITED WARRANTY CERTIFY warrants the Products against defects in materials and workmanship under normal use for a period of six (6) months from the date the Products are delivered to you, and will replace defective Products at no cost to you, so long as you return the defective Products pursuant to the instructions that will be provided to you, along with all accessories, cords, cables, parts, and documentation included, within fourteen (14) days of receiving replacement Products. When you initiate a return pursuant to this Limited Warranty, you will be asked to provide a credit card number to CERTIFY. In the event you fail to return the Products to CERTIFY as set forth above, CERTIFY reserves the right to charge either your credit card. To initiate a return pursuant to this Limited Warranty, please contact support@certifyglobal.com . EXCLUSIONS This Limited Warranty does not apply to any products you purchase from a third party. Any products you purchase from a third party are subject to the warranties of the third party. This Limited Warranty does not apply outside the warranty period set forth in this Hardware Policy.
